member.name: M:RUL.RulCol.RandColor
member.summary: Returns a completely random, opaque color

member.name: M:RUL.RulCol.RandColor(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns a random, opaque color with the specified lightness
member.param: Lightness between 0 and 1

member.name: M:RUL.RulCol.RandColor(UnityEngine.Color,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns a color that looks similar to the specified base color
member.param: The base for the random color
A value between 0 and 1 specifying the maximum variance from the base color's RGB components

member.name: M:RUL.RulCol.RandColor(RUL.Hues,RUL.LuminosityTypes)
member.summary: Returns a random color with the specified hue and luminosity
member.param: The approximate hue of the random color
The approximate luminosity of the random color

member.name: M:RUL.RulCol.RandColor(RUL.Hues)
member.summary: Returns a random color with the specified hue and random luminosity
member.param: The approximate hue of the random color

member.name: M:RUL.RulCol.RandColorBetween(UnityEngine.Color,UnityEngine.Color)
member.summary: Returns a color that is randomly interpolated between the given colors

member.name: M:RUL.RulCol.GetVarianceFactor(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns a coefficient between 0 and 1 that determines how much variety will actually be permitted for RandomizeColor. This makes getting natural, appealing variants of colors easier.

member.name: M:RUL.RulCol.ConvertColor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Converts the given color from the original 0-255 to unity's 0-1 range

member.summary: Includes both the lower and the upper bound

member.summary: Only includes the lower bound

member.name: F:RUL.InclusionOptions.Upper
member.summary: Only includes the upper bound

member.name: F:RUL.InclusionOptions.None
member.summary: Both bounds are excluded

member.summary: Returns a random, one-dimensional array of floats between 0 and 1

member.summary: Returns a random, two-dimensional array of floats between 0 and 1

member.name: M:RUL.RulNoise.RandPerlinNoise2(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns 2 dimensional perlin noise of the specified size and with default parameters

member.name: M:RUL.RulNoise.RandPerlinNoise2(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns 2 dimensional perlin noise of the specified size and with the given parameters. See documentation for more information on parameters and recommended values.
member.param: The width of the noise
The height of the noise
The frequency of the noise function.A high frequency will make the noise look more random while a low frequency will make the noise look more flat and bland. Default : 1
The rate at which the frequency decreases for each octave. Increasing this value will make the noise rougher, while decreasing it will make it smoother. Default : 0.5 , Min : 0

The octave count determines how many noise functions are combined. Increasing this value will make the noise look more fractal, decreasing it will make the noise look more simple and stylized. Increasing this value will significantly increase computation time. Default : 6 , Min : 1 , Max : 32
The highest value any point in the noise can have. Default : 1

Upper bound for the y-component
